Activity: Check emails, prioritize tasks for the day. Grab a large coffee.
Focus on implementing visual cues to guide the player and communicate game information. Identify key areas where visual cues are needed, such as objectives, pathways, and points of interest.
Design visual cues that are clear, intuitive, and visually consistent with the game's art style. Consider using colors, shapes, and animations to convey information effectively.
Implement the visual cues into the game level. Ensure that they are easily visible and understandable to the player. Iterate based on team feedback.
Lunch, maybe some burgers at that joint down the street. Good team bonding time.
Test the implemented visual cues and gather feedback from the team. Make adjustments to improve their effectiveness and clarity.
Final polish on all visual elements implemented this week, making sure everything is cohesive.
Document all the visual changes and implementation details for the week. Prepare a summary report for the team. Let @lpro-1 and @cdev-1 to check and make sure everything is good.
Review the week's accomplishments and plan for next week's tasks. Relax and browse some funny cat videos before heading home.
